attributes.comment:
Agency Name: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services
Docket number: USCIS-2006-0044

To whom it may concern:
We were recently notified that the USCIS will be raising fees by up to 66% for
adoption related petitions. Adoption is a wonderful thing and has been pursued by
many loving families, but the hardship that has already been taken on due to
current regulations is sure to be made even more difficult (financially and
emotionally) if the newly proposed regulations are put into action. Loving couples,
many who have waited countless years to start a family (due to infertility, loss of a
child, or other reasons) are having insult added to injury by the adoption
process/timelines lengthening and becoming even more costly. The current
expiration timelines of documents cause many wonderful "families to be" to have
to subject themselves to initial fees and then renewals of all of the required forms.
With the adoption timelines lengthening for many countries, some to over 18
months, it is most certain that adoption families will be required to take time off of
work, and reach into their wallets yet again to pay for adoption related petitions,
so that they may finally reach their goals of finally becoming a family.
Please do reconsider putting these regulations into affect as they are hurtful to
those who are looking to adopt.
Thank you.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Deborah L. Hayes
